info.name: mlflow
info.description: The open source developer platform to build AI/LLM applications and models with confidence. Enhance your AI applications with end-to-end tracking, observability, and evaluations, all in one integrated platform.

issues.title: [BUG] mlflow.genai.datasets.create_dataset throws ConnectionError when registering dataset
issues.body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [x] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Where did you encounter this bug?

Local machine

### MLflow version

- Client: 1.x.y
- Tracking server: 3.5.1


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: windows
- **Python version**: 3.11
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

When attempting to create a dataset, mlflow is throwing a connection error. Is it a bug or am I missing some step ?

Reference - https://mlflow.org/docs/3.5.1/genai/datasets/end-to-end-workflow/#step-4-create-an-evaluation-dataset



### Tracking information

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```shell
MLflow version: 3.5.1
Tracking URI: http://localhost:5000/
```


### Code to reproduce issue

```
import mlflow
from mlflow.genai.datasets import create_dataset

mlflow.set_tracking_uri("http://localhost:5000")
mlflow.set_experiment("dummy")

print(mlflow.get_experiment_by_name("dummy").experiment_id)

with mlflow.start_run():
    mlflow.log_param("param1", "value1")

dataset = create_dataset(
    name="ag_news_classifier_sample",
    experiment_id=mlflow.get_experiment_by_name("dummy").experiment_id,
    tags={"stage": "testing"},
)
```

### Stack trace

[stack_trace.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23447515/stack_trace.txt)

### Other info / logs

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
REPLACE_ME
```


### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow model serving, deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [x] `area/evaluation`: MLflow model evaluation features, evaluation metrics, and evaluation workflows
- [ ] `area/prompt`: MLflow prompt engineering features, prompt templates, and prompt management
- [ ] `area/tracing`: MLflow Tracing features, tracing APIs, and LLM tracing functionality
- [ ] `area/gateway`: MLflow AI Gateway client APIs, server, and third-party integrations
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages

issues.title: [BUG]UI Fetching tacedata failed

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

issues.body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [x] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Where did you encounter this bug?

Local machine

### MLflow version

- Client: 3.5.1
- Tracking server: use docker compose built.Here is the docker_compose.yaml
```
services:
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15
    container_name: mlflow-postgres
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql/data
#    ports:
#      - "5432:5432"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER}"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 3s
      retries: 10

  minio:
    image: minio/minio:latest
    container_name: mlflow-minio
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./minio-data:/data
    command: server /data --console-address ":9001"
    ports:
      - "9000:9000"
      - "9001:9001"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost:${MINIO_PORT}/minio/health/live"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 3s
      retries: 20

  create-bucket:
    image: minio/mc:latest
    container_name: mlflow-create-bucket
    depends_on:
      minio:
        condition: service_healthy
    env_file:
      - .env
    entrypoint: >
      /bin/sh -c '
        mc alias set myminio http://${MINIO_HOST}:${MINIO_PORT} \
          ${MINIO_ROOT_USER} ${MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD} &&
        mc mb --ignore-existing myminio/${MINIO_BUCKET:-mlflow}
      '
    restart: "no"

  mlflow:
    image: [ghcr.io/mlflow/mlflow:${MLFLOW_VERSION}](http://ghcr.io/mlflow/mlflow:$%7BMLFLOW_VERSION%7D)
    container_name: mlflow-server
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
      minio:
        condition: service_healthy
      create-bucket:
        condition: service_completed_successfully
    env_file:
      - .env
    environment:
      HTTP_PROXY: http://192.168.80.80:15732/
      HTTPS_PROXY: http://192.168.80.80:15732/

    command: >
      /bin/bash -c "
        pip install --no-cache-dir psycopg2-binary boto3 &&
        mlflow server \
          --backend-store-uri ${MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI} \
          --default-artifact-root ${MLFLOW_DEFAULT_ARTIFACT_ROOT} \
          --host ${MLFLOW_HOST} \
          --port ${MLFLOW_PORT}
      "
    ports:
      - "${MLFLOW_PORT}:${MLFLOW_PORT}"
```

### System information

mlflow doctor
==================================================
System information: Windows 10.0.19045
Python version: 3.11.13
MLflow version: 3.5.1
MLflow module location: D:\Anaconda3_202410\envs\dra\Lib\site-packages\mlflow\__init__.py
Tracking URI: http://192.168.80.134:5000
Registry URI: http://192.168.80.134:5000
MLflow environment variables:
  MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL: http://192.168.80.134:9000
  MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI: http://192.168.80.134:5000
MLflow dependencies:
  Flask: 3.1.2
  Flask-CORS: 6.0.1
  aiohttp: 3.12.15
  alembic: 1.16.5
  boto3: 1.40.18
  botocore: 1.40.18
  cryptography: 45.0.6
  docker: 7.1.0
  fastapi: 0.117.1
  fastmcp: 2.11.3
  graphene: 3.4.3
  langchain: 0.3.22
  matplotlib: 3.10.5
  mlflow-skinny: 3.5.1
  mlflow-tracing: 3.5.1
  numpy: 1.26.4
  pandas: 2.3.2
  pyarrow: 18.1.0
  scikit-learn: 1.7.1
  scipy: 1.16.1
  sqlalchemy: 2.0.43
  tiktoken: 0.11.0
  uvicorn: 0.35.0
  waitress: 3.0.2


### Describe the problem

Web ui raise errorÔºö
`{
    "error_code": "NOT_FOUND",
    "message": "Trace data not found for path=traces.json"
}`
```
FetchUtils.ts:140 
ËØ∑Ê±ÇÁΩëÂùÄ
http://192.168.80.134:5000/ajax-api/2.0/mlflow/get-trace-artifact?request_id=tr-541ad49c2472c953408b1528d77fbeed
ËØ∑Ê±ÇÊñπÊ≥ï
GET
Áä∂ÊÄÅ‰ª£Á†Å
404 Not Found
ËøúÁ®ãÂú∞ÂùÄ
192.168.80.134:5000
```
HoweverÔºåI check the minio storeÔºåit has stored the trace.json

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1acce200-83e0-4ef9-99e9-a86dc01c356c)
It seems like UI use the wrong address when fetching the trace.json, I don't know how to solve this problem

### Tracking information

mlflow doctor
==================================================

Python version: 3.11.13
MLflow version: 3.5.1
MLflow module location: D:\Anaconda3_202410\envs\dra\Lib\site-packages\mlflow\__init__.py

MLflow dependencies:

  Flask-CORS: 6.0.1
  aiohttp: 3.12.15
  alembic: 1.16.5
  boto3: 1.40.18
  botocore: 1.40.18
  cryptography: 45.0.6

  pandas: 2.3.2
  pyarrow: 18.1.0

  scipy: 1.16.1
  sqlalchemy: 2.0.43

  waitress: 3.0.2



### Code to reproduce issue

```
import mlflow
mlflow.set_tracking_uri("http://192.168.80.134:5000")
 
# ÂàõÂª∫ÂÆûÈ™åÔºàÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÂ≠òÂú®Ôºâ
try:
    experiment = mlflow.create_experiment("remote_trace_demo", 
    artifact_location="s3://mlflow/")
except Exception as e:
    if "already exists" in str(e):
        experiment = mlflow.get_experiment_by_name("trace_test_experiment").experiment_id
    else:
        print(f"ÂàõÂª∫ÂÆûÈ™åÂ§±Ë¥•: {e}")


# ÊµãËØïtraceÂäüËÉΩ
@mlflow.trace
def test_function(x, y):
    return x + y
# ÊâßË°åÂ∏¶traceÁöÑÂáΩÊï∞
with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment) as run:
    result = test_function(1, 2)
```



### Stack trace

Web ui raise errorÔºö
`{
    "error_code": "NOT_FOUND",
    "message": "Trace data not found for path=traces.json"
}`

issues.title: [BUG]runner.run_streamed with handoff creates separate traces for chained agents
issues.body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [x] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Where did you encounter this bug?

Local machine

### MLflow version

Local machine
### MLflow version
mlflow 3.5.1
### System information
## üêõ Bug Report: `runner.run_streamed` with `handoff` creates separate traces for chained agents
### üîç Summary
When chaining multiple Agents using the OpenAI Agents SDK **`handoff` mechanism** and executing the sequence via **`runner.run_streamed`**, the expected behavior of a single, continuous trace is not achieved. Instead, each Agent in the chain produces a **separate, independent MLflow Trace**, breaking the end-to-end visibility of the agent execution flow.
### üìù Description
We are utilizing the ` OpenAI Agents SDK ` to build complex workflows where one Agent's output is passed to the next Agent (chained using `handoff`).
When executing this chain using the streaming method, **`runner.run_streamed()`**, the MLflow tracing functionality appears to reset or re-initialize a new run/trace context at the transition point between Agents (i.e., where the `handoff` occurs).
**Expected Behavior:**
The entire sequence of agent calls, from the initial trigger through all subsequent `handoff` steps, should be recorded as a **single, unified MLflow Trace/Run** that captures the entire conversation flow, including intermediate tool calls and final outputs.
**Actual Behavior:**
The execution results in **$N$ distinct MLflow Traces** (where $N$ is the number of agents in the chain). Each trace only captures the activity of the specific Agent responsible for that segment of execution. This makes debugging and analyzing the complete, end-to-end agent logic extremely difficult.
### Describe the problem
Three Agents were connected in series, resulting in three traces


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:macos
- **Python version**:3.11
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

Three Agents were connected in series, resulting in three traces

The following script can reproduce the problem

[agent_coordinator.py](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23440090/agent_coordinator.py)

### Tracking information

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```shell
REPLACE_ME
```


### Code to reproduce issue

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
REPLACE_ME
```


### Stack trace

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
REPLACE_ME
```


### Other info / logs

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
REPLACE_ME
```


### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow model serving, deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/evaluation`: MLflow model evaluation features, evaluation metrics, and evaluation workflows
- [ ] `area/prompt`: MLflow prompt engineering features, prompt templates, and prompt management
- [ ] `area/tracing`: MLflow Tracing features, tracing APIs, and LLM tracing functionality
- [ ] `area/gateway`: MLflow AI Gateway client APIs, server, and third-party integrations
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages

issues.title: MLflow MCP server provides no tools in Claude Code

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

issues.body:
MLflow MCP server starts running fine but provides no tools in Claude Code

```
‚îÇ Mlflow MCP Server                                                                                            ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                                                                                              ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Status: ‚úî connected                                                                                          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Command: uv                                                                                                  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Args: run --no-project --with mlflow[mcp]>=3.5.1 mlflow mcp run                                              ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Config location/Users/harutaka.kawamura/.claude.json [project:                                               ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                /Users/harutaka.kawamura/Desktop/repositories/mlflow]                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ Capabilities: none         üëàüëàüëà                                                                                  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                                                                                              ‚îÇ
‚îÇ ‚ùØ 1. Reconnect                                                                                               ‚îÇ
‚îÇ   2. Disable  
```

MCP config:

```json
        "mlflow": {
          "type": "stdio",
          "command": "uv",
          "args": [
            "run",
            "--no-project",
            "--with",
            "mlflow[mcp]>=3.5.1",
            "mlflow",
            "mcp",
            "run"

        }

```

issues.title: [FR] Add the names of Cew / Task / Agent / LLM of CrewAI to the mlflow UI

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

labels.name: domain/platform
labels.description: Feature requests about platform foundation, not specific to a problem domain

issues.body: ### Willingness to contribute Yes. I can contribute this feature independently. ### Proposal Summary Currently, when using crews (with flow)/agents/tasks/LLMs following the Crew AI documentation (without creating a subclass), the rendering in mlflow looks like this: Exemple of an agent with a Task ```python @agent def researcher(self) -> Agent: return Agent( config=self.agents_config['researcher'], # type: ignore[index] verbose=True, tools=[SerperDevTool()] ) @task def reporting_task(self) -> Task: return Task( config=self.tasks_config['reporting_task'] # type: ignore[index] ) @crew def crew(self) -> Crew: return Crew( agents=[ self.researcher(), self.reporting_analyst() ], tasks=[ self.reporting_task() ], process=Process.sequential ) ``` The purpose of this feature is to automatically display the following in the UI: - Crew names - Task names - Agent roles - LLM model names ### Motivation > #### What is the use case for this feature? Increase visibility for Crews with many tasks and agents, and Flows in general. Example: Flow => Crew A => If condition is True then Crew B else Crew C. As it is, it's hard to tell which Crew has been launched with the mlflow UI. > #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? Improve the integration of the CrewAI framework > #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? I use a lot mlflow to monitor my agent (with CrewAI or DSPY). And this feature would be a real benefit in helping me debug problems. > #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? In my opinion, it's not difficult to achieve. ### Details Here an exemple of the result with this feature : ### What machine learning domain(s) is this feature request about? - [ ] `domain/genai`: LLMs, Agents, and other GenAI-related use cases - [ ] `domain/classical-ml`: Traditional machine learning, such as linear regression. - [ ] `domain/deep-learning`: Deep learning and neural networks. - [x] `domain/platform`: MLflow platform foundation, not specific to a particular machine learning domain. ### What area(s) of MLflow is this feature request about? - [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging - [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry - [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow model serving, deployment tools, Spark UDFs - [ ] `area/evaluation`: MLflow model evaluation features, evaluation metrics, and evaluation workflows - [ ] `area/prompt`: MLflow prompt engineering features, prompt templates, and prompt management - [x] `area/tracing`: MLflow Tracing features, tracing APIs, and LLM tracing functionality - [ ] `area/gateway`: MLflow AI Gateway client APIs, server, and third-party integrations - [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends - [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting - [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages

issues.title: [FR] Add webhook functionality for trace-related events

labels.name: domain/genai
labels.description: Feature requests related to GenAI/LLM use cases

issues.body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

### Proposal Summary

I propose adding webhook functionality for key events originating from MLflow Tracing. For example, this would allow sending real-time notifications to a specified URL when a code error is detected during a trace execution or when the latency of a specific trace exceeds a configured threshold. This would enable proactive monitoring and rapid response to the state of Agent applications.

### Motivation

> #### What is the use case for this feature?
By adding real-time, webhook-based notification capabilities, users can immediately recognize and respond to issues without having to periodically check the MLflow UI. This would be a great help in reducing issue response times.

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
An automated monitoring and notification system is essential for reliable Agent service operations. This would minimize service downtime and maximize operational efficiency.


### Details

_No response_

### What machine learning domain(s) is this feature request about?

- [x] `domain/genai`: LLMs, Agents, and other GenAI-related use cases
- [ ] `domain/classical-ml`: Traditional machine learning, such as linear regression.
- [ ] `domain/deep-learning`: Deep learning and neural networks.
- [ ] `domain/platform`: MLflow platform foundation, not specific to a particular machine learning domain.

### What area(s) of MLflow is this feature request about?

- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow model serving, deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/evaluation`: MLflow model evaluation features, evaluation metrics, and evaluation workflows
- [ ] `area/prompt`: MLflow prompt engineering features, prompt templates, and prompt management

issues.title: [BUG] selectedEvaluationId is looked up before the experiments load when the URL is opened in a new tab.

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

issues.body:
### MLflow version

3.5.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux/Mac OS
- **Python version**: 3.13.5

### Describe the problem

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/448a622eb1ee14b6b25a002c954c0c7dce4976af/mlflow/server/js/src/shared/web-shared/genai-traces-table/hooks/useActiveEvaluation.tsx#L16-L28

When opening a URL with a `selectedEvaluationId` parameter, when the UI is not yet loaded (for example in a new tab), the code will attempt to find it before the evaluations are loaded, the evaluation is not found, and the parameter is reset. 

This method should be executed after the evaluations load.

### Steps to reproduce the bug

- Copy a url for a specific experiment and evaluation ex. `/#/experiments/4/traces?selectedEvaluationId=tr-df750d5531d5013f921c7edc2658ec88`

- Open it in a new tab.

- The trace id is looked up before the evaluations load, is not found and the `selectedEvaluationId` parameter is removed from the URL.

- The evaluations load for the experiment, but no evaluation is selected.

### Code to generate data required to reproduce the bug

_No response_

### Is the console panel in DevTools showing errors relevant to the bug?

_No response_

### Does the network panel in DevTools contain failed requests relevant to the bug?

_No response_

issues.title: [FR] Serialization parity between `local` and `virtualenv` values for `env_manager` in spark_udf

labels.name: area/scoring
labels.description: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs

labels.name: domain/deep-learning
labels.description: Feature requests for Deep Learning use cases

labels.name: domain/classical-ml
labels.description: Feature requests for Classical ML use cases

labels.name: domain/platform
labels.description: Feature requests about platform foundation, not specific to a problem domain

issues.body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.

### Proposal Summary

The `mlflow.pyfunc.spark_udf` high level API has different I/O limitations depending on the `env_manager` parameter used (`"local"` vs `"virtualenv"`). Since one dimension here is a modeling choice and the other is an operational choice, we should remove this coupling and provide consistent I/O parity between the two env manager settings.

### Motivation

> #### What is the use case for this feature?
Models that include input data types that are not JSON serializable but are pyarrow serializable fail to predict if loaded into a `spark_udf` with `env_manager = "virtualenv"`, while they do work with `env_manager="local"`. Conversely, if something is JSON serializable but not pyarrow serializable, it will work only with `env_manager = "virtualenv"` and not `env_manager="local"`

This argues for one of two feature approaches:
1. Adopt a body of type regressions against the JSON serialization powering the scoring server, to ensure parity with pyarrow (which is the usual serialization pattern supported in spark)
2. [Preferred, but probably harder] adjust the communication to the Scoring Server to leverage Arrow Flight RPC over JSON RESTful interface. This would delegate parity to the arrow project, and likely also result in increased performance of the scoring server.

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?
Standard spark communication with executors is driven through pyarrow, while communication to the scoring server is through JSON request payload. This causes a lack of parity in model compatibility for `mlflow.pyfunc.spark_udf()` calls when input data is serializable into pyarrow and not json, or vice versa. In addition, if there are differences in the serialization framework (for instance, the treatment of nulls) this can lead to model output changes that result from a strictly operational refactor.

This can be for quite common datatypes; an example of one that works with `env_manager="local"` but not `env_manager = "virtualenv"` is the python base `binary` type, which may for instance be used to represent image media loaded from external storage.

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?

We have strict policies around copying media outside of governed s3 buckets, and so need to persist a copy in memory to avoid an expensive i/o operation on a GPU executor. Simultaneously, we value the strict environment guarantees provided by `env_manager = "virtualenv"`.

> #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case?

You cannot currently encapsulate models leveraging binary type data using the `virtualenv` eng

### Details

_No response_

### What machine learning domain(s) is this feature request about?

- [ ] `domain/genai`: LLMs, Agents, and other GenAI-related use cases
- [x] `domain/classical-ml`: Traditional machine learning, such as linear regression.
- [x] `domain/deep-learning`: Deep learning and neural networks.
- [x] `domain/platform`: MLflow platform foundation, not specific to a particular machine learning domain.

### What area(s) of MLflow is this feature request about?

- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [x] `area/scoring`: MLflow model serving, deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/evaluation`: MLflow model evaluation features, evaluation metrics, and evaluation workflows
- [ ] `area/prompt`: MLflow prompt engineering features, prompt templates, and prompt management
- [ ] `area/tracing`: MLflow Tracing features, tracing APIs, and LLM tracing functionality
- [ ] `area/gateway`: MLflow AI Gateway client APIs, server, and third-party integrations
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages

issues.title: [BUG] Cannot remove Trace Tags from the UI

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

issues.body: ### MLflow version 3.5.1 ### System information - **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: OS X Tahoe 26.0.1 - **Python version**: 3.11.7 - **yarn version, if running the dev UI**: 4.9.1 (built the UI via `yarn build`) ### Describe the problem Cannot remove tags that were assigned to a trace from the UI. Removing from Python seems to be working, because there it's still using the old v2 endpoint. The stack trace from the server is the following: ``` 2025/11/06 18:13:29 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/3.0/mlflow/traces/tr-5cdb4c1edfaec66546907c1c95c3bbcd/tags [DELETE] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1511, in wsgi_app response = self.full_dispatch_request() File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 919, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.handle_user_exception(e) File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask_cors/extension.py", line 176, in wrapped_function return cors_after_request(app.make_response(f(*args, **kwargs))) File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 917, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.dispatch_request() File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 902, in dispatch_request return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**view_args) # type: ignore[no-any-return] File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 715, in wrapper return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/kirill/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 756, in wrapper return func(*args, **kwargs) TypeError: _delete_trace_tag() got an unexpected keyword argument 'trace_id' ``` I have noticed that the protobuf definition changed between V2 and V3, where V3 has `request_id` instead of `trace_id`. I have tried to make a duplicate of the `mlflow.server.handlers._delete_trace_tag` function with a different name of the argument, which got me to step inside of the function, however, after that I got problems with handling the `key` argument. I assume this is happening because `mlflow.server.handlers._get_request_message` cannot handle this particular request and throws that it doesn't see the `key` argument. Assume this is because this request is different from usual: - DELETE request - No body - Argument is in the query parameter This was as far as I went before it started feeling to me like this is too big for me to dig into myself. ### Steps to reproduce the bug 1) Create a trace and add a span to it 2) Navigate to the trace in the UI 3) Check the tickbox near the trace 4) Open the "Actions" dropdown -> Edit Tags 5) Click on the x near `foo: bar` tag 6) Click on the "Save tags" button to save changes Expected: The selected tag gets deleted Actual: Tag doesn't get deleted ### Code to generate data required to reproduce the bug While running an mlflow server locally: ```python import mlflow mlflow.set_tracking_uri("http://localhost:5000") with mlflow.start_run(): with mlflow.start_span("foo") as sp: print("bar") cl = mlflow.client.MlflowClient() cl.set_trace_tag(sp.request_id, "foo", "bar") ``` ### Is the console panel in DevTools showing errors relevant to the bug? ### Does the network panel in DevTools contain failed requests relevant to the bug? ``` DELETE http://localhost:5000/ajax-api/3.0/mlflow/traces/tr-5cdb4c1edfaec66546907c1c95c3bbcd/tags?key=foo Status Code: 500 ```

issues.title: [BUG] Llama-index tracer crashes when using LLMs that do not report token usage
issues.body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [x] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Where did you encounter this bug?

Local machine

### MLflow version

- Client: 3.5.1
- Tracking server: 3.5.1


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **Python version**: 3.13.5


### Describe the problem

The llamaindex tracer expects all the LLMs from Llamaindex to return token usage in the `additional_kwargs` field. 
However, not all LLM return these information like the Llamaindex's `OpenAI` class. This causes a KeyError exception that prevents traces data to be logged in async code.

The UI then shows `No trace data available` when attempting to see detailed trace view.

### Tracking information

```shell
System information: Windows 10.0.22631
Python version: 3.13.5
MLflow version: 3.5.1
MLflow module location: C:\Users\flobacho\PycharmProjects\tests_mlflow3\.venv\Lib\site-packages\mlflow\__init__.py
Tracking URI: file:///C:/Users/flobacho/PycharmProjects/tests_mlflow3/mlruns
Registry URI: file:///C:/Users/flobacho/PycharmProjects/tests_mlflow3/mlruns
MLflow dependencies: 
  Flask: 3.1.2
  Flask-CORS: 6.0.1
  aiohttp: 3.13.2
  alembic: 1.17.1
  cryptography: 46.0.3
  docker: 7.1.0
  fastapi: 0.120.2
  graphene: 3.4.3
  matplotlib: 3.10.7
  mlflow-skinny: 3.5.1
  mlflow-tracing: 3.5.1
  numpy: 2.3.4
  pandas: 2.2.3
  pyarrow: 21.0.0
  scikit-learn: 1.7.2
  scipy: 1.16.3
  sqlalchemy: 2.0.44
  tiktoken: 0.12.0
  uvicorn: 0.38.0
  waitress: 3.0.2
```


### Code to reproduce issue

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```python
import asyncio
import logging
import mlflow
from llama_index.core.base.llms.types import ChatMessage
from llama_index.llms.google_genai import GoogleGenAI

# Must set the logging level to DEBUG to see the error.
logging.getLogger("mlflow.llama_index.tracer").setLevel(logging.DEBUG)

mlflow.llama_index.autolog()

@mlflow.trace
async def call_llm(message: str) -> str:
    llm = GoogleGenAI(model="gemini-2.5-flash-lite", api_key="AIzaSyCntCJ5Xbtrl48Gd4RXCYf0zpcZjuR9F98")
    response = await llm.achat(
        messages=[ChatMessage(role="user", content=message)]
    )
    return str(response)

asyncio.run(call_llm("What is the capital of France?"))
```


### Stack trace

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
DEBUG mlflow.llama_index.tracer: Failed to set TokenUsage to the span: 'prompt_tokens'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\flobacho\PycharmProjects\tests_mlflow3\.venv\Lib\site-packages\mlflow\llama_index\tracer.py", line 454, in _parse_usage
    TokenUsageKey.INPUT_TOKENS: usage["prompt_tokens"],
                                ~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
KeyError: 'prompt_tokens'
```


### Other info / logs

_No response_

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow model serving, deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/evaluation`: MLflow model evaluation features, evaluation metrics, and evaluation workflows
- [ ] `area/prompt`: MLflow prompt engineering features, prompt templates, and prompt management
- [x] `area/tracing`: MLflow Tracing features, tracing APIs, and LLM tracing functionality
- [ ] `area/gateway`: MLflow AI Gateway client APIs, server, and third-party integrations
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
